Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black with two added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lion seated to right (haunch and one hind leg with added red blob remaining); two dilute lines above handle zone and part of one vertical stroke below.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA77. Lions are usually depicted facing right on Chalice Style chalices.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0904) (phase 2)
